    Summarize Variables

    Summarize.Rmd
    library(rubix)
library(cave)
data("mtcars")

    Introduction

    Summarize_ wrappers to the dplyr functions of the same name were developed to quickly QA the depth and breadth of data in a given dataframe. The most comprehensive function in this family of functions are the summarize_variables function, where counts are returned as well as a string of column names that can be easily converted back into a vector using the string_to_vector() function in the cave R package.

    rubix::summarize_variables(mtcars)
#> $SUMMARY
#> # A tibble: 11 x 7
#>    Variable COUNT DISTINCT_COUNT NA_COUNT NA_STR_COUNT BLANK_COUNT
#>    <chr>    <int>          <int>    <int>        <int>       <int>
#>  1 am          32              2        0            0           0
#>  2 carb        32              6        0            0           0
#>  3 cyl         32              3        0            0           0
#>  4 disp        32             27        0            0           0
#>  5 drat        32             22        0            0           0
#>  6 gear        32              3        0            0           0
#>  7 hp          32             22        0            0           0
#>  8 mpg         32             25        0            0           0
#>  9 qsec        32             30        0            0           0
#> 10 vs          32              2        0            0           0
#> 11 wt          32             29        0            0           0
#> # … with 1 more variable: DISTINCT_VALUES <chr>
#> 
#> $NUMERIC_CALCULATIONS
#> # A tibble: 11 x 18
#>    Variable    MEAN MEAN_NA MEDIAN MEDIAN_NA      SD   SD_NA    MAX MAX_NA   MIN
#>    <chr>      <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 am         0.406   0.406   0         0      0.499   0.499   1      1     0   
#>  2 carb       2.81    2.81    2         2      1.62    1.62    8      8     1   
#>  3 cyl        6.19    6.19    6         6      1.79    1.79    8      8     4   
#>  4 disp     231.    231.    196.      196.   124.    124.    472    472    71.1 
#>  5 drat       3.60    3.60    3.70      3.70   0.535   0.535   4.93   4.93  2.76
#>  6 gear       3.69    3.69    4         4      0.738   0.738   5      5     3   
#>  7 hp       147.    147.    123       123     68.6    68.6   335    335    52   
#>  8 mpg       20.1    20.1    19.2      19.2    6.03    6.03   33.9   33.9  10.4 
#>  9 qsec      17.8    17.8    17.7      17.7    1.79    1.79   22.9   22.9  14.5 
#> 10 vs         0.438   0.438   0         0      0.504   0.504   1      1     0   
#> 11 wt         3.22    3.22    3.32      3.32   0.978   0.978   5.42   5.42  1.51
#> # … with 8 more variables: MIN_NA <dbl>, SUM <dbl>, SUM_NA <dbl>,
#> #   DISTINCT_LENGTH <int>, NA_LENGTH <int>, BLANK_LENGTH <int>,
#> #   DISTINCT_STR <chr>, DISTINCT_STR_NA <chr>

    Summary functions include:
    1. Total and distinct counts
    2. Counts for NA (ie. ), NA strings (ie “NA”), and blank values that when combined, can provide an overview of missingness in the dataframe
    3. Unique values found within the particular variable in both a pipe-separated string as well as a R expression that can be evaluated back into a vector using the string_to_vector() function in the cave R package.

    The scope of the summary may also be limited by variable:

    rubix::summarize_variables(mtcars, mpg, cyl)
#> Error in build_longer_spec(data, !!cols, names_to = names_to, values_to = values_to, : object 'cyl' not found

    Summarize Numeric Variables

    Additional metrics can be derived from variables that contain numeric data. The summarize_numeric_var() function either takes variables as arguments or selects for variables of numeric, integer, or double classes and calculates summary statistics with both na.rm = FALSE (all _NA suffixed outputs) and na.rm = TRUE parameters.

    rubix::summarize_numeric_vars(mtcars)
#> Error: 'summarize_numeric_vars' is not an exported object from 'namespace:rubix'

    Like the sibling function, this function also may take specific variables as arguments.

    rubix::summarize_numeric_vars(mtcars, cyl, disp)
#> Error: 'summarize_numeric_vars' is not an exported object from 'namespace:rubix'

    However, if one of the arguments is not an integer, numeric, or double, an error will be thrown:

    mtcars2 <- mtcars
mtcars2$cyl <- as.character(mtcars2$cyl)
rubix::summarize_numeric_vars(mtcars2, cyl, disp)
#> Error: 'summarize_numeric_vars' is not an exported object from 'namespace:rubix'

    Summarizing Variable Values

    While summarize_ functions for variables provides a comprehensive set of summary statistics and metadata, the summarize_values() function returns all counts for the unique values for each variable.

    rubix::summarize_values(mtcars)
#> Warning: 'rubix::summarize_values' is deprecated.
#> Use 'value_count' instead.
#> See help("Deprecated")
#> # A tibble: 11 x 9
#>    name  value NET_COUNT COUNT DISTINCT_COUNT NA_COUNT NA_STR_COUNT BLANK_COUNT
#>    <chr> <chr>     <int> <int>          <int>    <int>        <int>       <int>
#>  1 am    0|1          32    32              2        0            0           0
#>  2 carb  1|2|…        32    32              6        0            0           0
#>  3 cyl   4|6|8        32    32              3        0            0           0
#>  4 disp  108|…        32    32             27        0            0           0
#>  5 drat  2.76…        32    32             22        0            0           0
#>  6 gear  3|4|5        32    32              3        0            0           0
#>  7 hp    105|…        32    32             22        0            0           0
#>  8 mpg   10.4…        32    32             25        0            0           0
#>  9 qsec  14.5…        32    32             30        0            0           0
#> 10 vs    0|1          32    32              2        0            0           0
#> 11 wt    1.51…        32    32             29        0            0           0
#> # … with 1 more variable: DISTINCT_VALUES_NA <chr>
